page.title: 15CHILDHOOD IN ADELAIDE(ii)
page.content: Her father worked on a farm and she had to help in the Easter and Summer holidays.When her father chopped an acre of sugar beet she had to follow him on her hands and knees and single them out so that there was only one shoot left.Children earned their pocket money by doing this.The school hours 9am to noon and from 2pm to 4pm. She had to walk home at lunchtime as school dinners were not provided.At playtime,she joined her friends in skipping games.As the house was near the railway line,she remembers rushing out to watch the "Flying Scotsman" ,the fasted train between London and Edinburgh in the 1950s ,go by.She also used to wave to the Queen and other members of the Royal Family on their way to Sandringham ,Norfolk.At the age of 14 she went to work in the paper factory at Adelaide.
